div.p: If "piracy" means using the creative property of others without their permission—if "if value, then right" is true—then the history of the content industry is a history of piracy. Every important sector of "big media" today—film, records, radio, and cable TV—was born of a kind of piracy so defined. The consistent story is how last generation's pirates join this generation's country club—until now.
